Translation of 郭店楚簡-語叢四(en) into English.

p.seg: Words are to start (something),
emotions for making (it) last.
“There are no words that are not matched,
there is no kindness that is not returned”.
If one speaks carelessly,
then the walls have ears.
Words going forth wound others;
words coming back wound oneself.
Goodness of speaking
is enough to preserve one to the end of one’s life.
(But) the blessings of three generations
are not enough (to overcome) the taking out of a
sharp (weapon) [=damaging words].
If one is not cautious with one’s mouth,
it is like [not] closing one’s door,
then one’s ill words will return upon oneself,
and death will come any day.
In every case, in the way of persuasion,
what is pressing is the highest priority.
Once you have gotten at what is pressing (for whom you want to persuade),
in speaking you must be sure to touch upon it.
If when you touch upon it is not permitted,
then you must embellish it with some artifice,
so as not to let (others) to understand you.
then you must embellish it with some artifice,
then you will go away with flowing moisture (=full flow of generosity)
One who steals a belt hook is put to death.
One who steals a state is made lord.
The gate of the lord
is where righteous men are maintained.
The pickled sauce (in the puddle) on the carriage cover
does not see (=is completely separated from) the waters of the rivers and lakes.
The common woman and her partner husband
do not know (the difference between) the petty men and the gentlemen of their district.
Eating chives (=poorly),
how do they know to last to the end of a full year?
Associating early with worthy men:
this is referred as acting step by step.
When worthy men are not at his side,
this is known as errant confusion.
If he does not make his plans with the clever,
this is known as deceiving himself.
If he makes his plans with the clever early,
this is known as strengthening his foundation.
When there is some great hero in the state,
you must be the first to associate with him as a peer.
If he does not dislike you giving him difficult tasks,
then you must bring your affair to its final completion.
If having completed it (his task) he (starts) doubting (you),
then make his removal very comfortable (with prizes).
And if (he) is about to meet failure,
then you (should) cut out (=abandon) the hero.
Those who appreciate a tree’s shade
will not cut off its branches.
Those who appreciate a pool
will not block up its source.
Those who are good at employing their inferiors
treat them like the legs of the centipede:
as many as they are, they do no harm;
and though one cuts away at them, the centipede does not fall.
Those who are good at serving their superiors
do this the way the teeth serve the tongue,
to the end making no mistake.
Those who are good at [serving their friends]
do this like two wheels rolling together,
never breaking each other.
Those who are good at employing their people
are like the four seasons,
one departing as another comes on,
and the people never consider them a source of harm.
When a mountain has no long and narrow ridges (=is too steep)
it collapses;
when a wall has no thatching (to protect it and prop it up)
it collapses;
and when an officer has no friends,
it is not acceptable.
If the ruler has his planning ministers,
his territory is not cut up.
If an officer has his planning friends,
his speaking and conversation are not weak.
Although his courage and strength may be famous throughout the state,
they are no match for talent;
though money and jade may fill his room,
they are no match for planning;
though one’s population is strong and very numerous,
they are no match for right timing.
Therefore planning is to be valued.
